channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hegseth says soldiers in Wounded Knee Massacre of Lakota will keep their medals
item.description: U.S. Army soldiers who took part in the 1890 slaughter of Lakota men, women and children at Wounded Knee will keep their medals posthumously, Defense ...

item.title: Dominion and former Trump lawyer Rudy Giuliani settle defamation lawsuit
item.description: Lawyers for Dominion Voting Systems and Giuliani said both parties agreed to a “confidential settlement.” Terms were not disclosed.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is coming back to Nexstar and Sinclair’s ABC stations
item.description: “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” has been off the air on ABC stations in D.C. and other markets since Disney-owned ABC reinstated the late-night host Tuesday.

item.title: Scoop: Some of Congress' trips are being canceled ahead of a potential shutdown
item.description: Several official congressional trips that were scheduled for next week have been canceled due to the possibility of a government shutdown , Axios has ...

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel to return to Nexstar and Sinclair's ABC affiliates Friday
item.description: "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" will return to Nexstar and Sinclair's ABC affiliates Friday evening, the companies said. Why it matters: The move will bring the ...

item.title: Scoop: Schumer's private war room on government shutdown
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and his staff are closely coordinating their government shutdown strategy with outside liberal groups, A...

item.title: Elon Musk, Peter Thiel and Steve Bannon named in Epstein files released by Democrats
item.description: Elon Musk, Peter Thiel and Steve Bannon are all named in copies of Jeffrey Epstein 's daily schedules released Friday by Democrats on the House Oversi...

item.title: Congress is barreling toward a shutdown, despite the perils
item.description: Democrats say they won’t back a GOP bill to extend government funding and prevent a shutdown unless Republicans negotiate with them over health care.

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump officials to freeze billions in foreign aid
item.description: The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration to freeze more than $4 billion in foreign aid.

item.title: House Democrats release new records from Epstein estate
item.description: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee released redacted calendars, financial documents and flight logs from the estate.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Trump fires statistics chief after soft jobs report
item.description: The monthly jobs report showed just 73,000 jobs in July, with big reductions to May's and June's numbers

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
